resources.string: The aurora is only visible close to the geomagnetic poles which are located close to the north and south poles. This value shows your geomagnetic latitude. The best latitude for aurora sightings is around 67Â°.

Disturbances in earth\'s magnetic field is the cause of the aurora and is measured on a scale called the Kp index. This value shows the Kp index which ranges from 0 to 9. A higher value means higher chance to see the aurora.
Bad weather can block your view of the aurora. This value shows the visibility of the sky based on current weather conditions. 100% visibility means clear skies and is therefore ideal.

The aurora is only visible in the dark so the position of the sun is critical. This value shows how dark your current location is based on the sun\'s position. 100% darkness is perfect for aurora sightings.
